column1: Lutz  is an unincorporated census-designated place (CDP) in Hillsborough County
column3: United States. It is fifteen miles north of Tampa. The northern part of Lutz also makes up a portion of south Pasco County. The population was 19

column1: Lutz began with the construction of a small train depot on the Tampa Northern Railroad. The area surrounding the depot officially became known as "Lutz" when the U.S. Postal Service authorized a post office. The community was named for W. P. Lutz
column2: who was credited with bringing the railroad to town.As people moved to the rural community from Tampa
column3: the Lutz area continued to grow until it no longer depended on the "Lutz Junction"
column4: which was demolished in the late 1960s.

column2: a replica of the depot was rebuilt in the approximate location
column3: which is now at the intersection of Lutz-Lake Fern Road and U.S. Highway 41. The post office's structure is still in the same place today
column4: although it is now an art gallery. A public library is located behind the train depot replica. This area is known as "Beautiful Downtown Lutz".Part of the movie Edward Scissorhands was filmed on Tinsmith Circle in the neighborhood of Carpenter's Run in north Lutz in Pasco County. In the credits the town is named in the "Thank you" section.

column1: Lutz is located in northwestern Hillsborough County at 28°8′22″N 82°27′43″W (28.139428
column2: -82.462028). It is bordered to the east by the city of Tampa
column3: to the south by the Lake Magdalene and University unincorporated communities
column4: and to the west by unincorporated Northdale and Cheval
column5: all in Hillsborough County. To the north
column6: Lutz is bordered by Land o' Lakes and Wesley Chapel in Pasco County.

column1: Interstate 275 runs through the east side of Lutz
column2: joining its parent highway Interstate 75 in the northeast corner of the community. U.S. Route 41 runs through the center of Lutz
column3: and Florida State 597 forms part of the western border. Downtown Tampa is 14 miles (23 km) to the south.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the Lutz CDP has a total area of 27.1 square miles (70.2 km2)
column3: of which 24.6 square miles (63.8 km2) are land and 2.5 square miles (6.4 km2)

column1: ZIP codes which serve Lutz and the surrounding areas are 33548
column3: 33558 and 33559. These ZIP codes extend north past the Hillsborough County line to State Road 54 in unincorporated southern Pasco County. That area is also called Lutz
column4: and often referred to as "Pasco Lutz" by residents and newspapers.
